awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Adaptive Control of Linear StochasticSystems Driven by Poorly Known Markov Processes
awd_abstract_narration: This proposal deals with control of linear systems driven by               poorly known Markov processes and white noise.  Nonlinear                       filtering techniques can give the conditional probability                       distribution of the current state of the Markov process in terms                of system's history.  In this way the controller learns about the               poorly known processes based on the observation of their past                   performance.                                                                         Specific examples of applications of the type of control                   problems discussed in this proposal include models of solar                     electric generating stations, where the Markov process is the                   variation of the solar power due to cloud cover, and certain                    pursuit-evasion problems, where the pursuer bases its strategy on               the past performance of the evader.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
